evSOLve.JEvolution

Class JEvolution

  • java.lang.Object
    • evSOLve.JEvolution.JEvolution

  • public class JEvolution
extends java.lang.Object
    A quite general implementation of Evolutionary Algorithms.

    June 8, 2001

    0.9.8 $Id: JEvolution.java 566 2014-05-12 18:29:58Z helmut $

    Helmut A. Mayer

      • doEvolve

        public void doEvolve()
        The evolutionary cycle. Each call of this method performs a complete run of JEvolution until termination, hence, calling it n times will result in n evolutionary runs.

      • doEvolve

        public int doEvolve(int stepGenerations)
        Runs JEvolution for the specified number of generations. If stepGenerations <= 0, this call is identical to doEvolve(). If the complete evolutionary run has terminated, the return value is 0. Whenever a termination criterion is reached JEvolution terminates, even when the number of step generations has NOT been completed. Calling this method after termination of a run simply starts a new run. Calling doEvolve() after a number of step generations will complete the run until termination.
        Returns:
        the total number of completed generations (0, if run has terminated)
        See Also:
        doEvolve()

      • addChromosome

        public void addChromosome(Chromosome chromosome)
        Add a JEvolution native or a custom Chromosome to the Genotype. This way a JEvolution genotype can contain an arbitrary number of Chromosomes, but for writing a proper Phenotype class, the user has to be aware of the order of the chromosomes which corresponds to the order of adding it to the genotype. There is no restriction on the type of Chromosomes, i.e., you can use different Chromosomes in a genotype. Crossover is done separately for each Chromosome (with specific parameters set by the user). You may also shuffle Chromosomes.
        Parameters:
        chromosome - JEvolution native or custom Chromosome
        See Also:
        Phenotype.doOntogeny(java.util.List<evSOLve.JEvolution.chromosomes.Chromosome>), setShuffleRate(double)

      • getGenotypeModel

        public java.util.List<Chromosome> getGenotypeModel()
        Returns the genotype used by JEvolution. The returned genotype is identical to the one used by JEvolution to determine how the genotype of each individual is composed, so any changes to the returned List will change the genotype model.
        Returns:
        the structure of the genotype (a Vector of Chromosomes)
        See Also:
        addChromosome(evSOLve.JEvolution.chromosomes.Chromosome)

      • setPhenotype

        public void setPhenotype(Phenotype phenotype)
        Set the Phenotype with all the problem-specific code.
        Parameters:
        phenotype - Fitness code provided by user.

      • setSubPopulations

        public void setSubPopulations(int subPopulationCount)
                       throws JEvolutionException
        Sets the number of sub-populations (default = 1). The 'populationSize' is the size of each sub-population.
        Parameters:
        subPopulationCount - number of sub-populations
        Throws:
        JEvolutionException - count < 1

      • getPopulationSize

        public int getPopulationSize()
        Returns the population size, which is the number of offspring times the number of subPopulations (default 1).
        Returns:
        the total population size

      • setPopulationSize

        public void setPopulationSize(int populationSize)
                       throws JEvolutionException
        Changes population sizes.
        Parameters:
        populationSize - number of parents = number of offspring
        Throws:
        JEvolutionException - size < 0

      • setPopulationSize

        public void setPopulationSize(int parentCount,
                     int offspringCount)
                       throws JEvolutionException
        Changes population sizes. If the number of parents is less equal than the number of offspring (mu, lambda)-selection will be set here, also. However, you may change it using setSelection on your responsibility.
        Parameters:
        parentCount - the number of parents (mu in ES)
        offspringCount - the number of offspring (lambda in ES)
        Throws:
        JEvolutionException - if count < 1 or offspringCount < parentCount

      • getParents

        public Population getParents()
        Returns the current parent population. Note that the population is created after the first call to doEvolve().
        Returns:
        the current parent population
        See Also:
        Population.getIndividual(int), Individual.toFile(java.lang.String), doEvolve()

      • getSeedPopulation

        public SubPopulation getSeedPopulation()
        Returns the seedPopulation (may be empty).
        Returns:
        seedPopulation the sub-population of seed individuals
        See Also:
        SubPopulation.addIndividual(evSOLve.JEvolution.Individual)

      • setSeedPopulation

        public void setSeedPopulation(SubPopulation seedPopulation)
        Sets seed population. May be used to seed the start population with existing solutions (Individuals of previous runs). The size of the seed population is arbitrary, but it will be decimated to the set sub-population size (GP flavor), if it is larger. If it is smaller, the start sub-populations are completed with random individuals.
        Parameters:
        seedPopulation - sub-population of seed individuals
        See Also:
        SubPopulation.addIndividual(evSOLve.JEvolution.Individual)

      • recordPopulation

        public void recordPopulation(java.lang.String fileName)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        Writes the current (last) population to a file. This is useful for being able to store current evolution results and to continue the run in the future without starting from scratch.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the file whereto the current population is written
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Population.getIndividual(int), Individual.toFile(java.lang.String)

      • restorePopulation

        public void restorePopulation(java.lang.String fileName)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Deprecated. 
        Restores a population from a file, and uses this population as a seed population for a new evolution run. Note: Make sure to set up all JEvolution parameters (especially genotype and phenotype) BEFORE restoring the population using this method, as the restoration process needs correct parameters. It is not checked, if the restored population meets the parameter setup, e.g., you could restore the population of a run having evolved neural networks, and use it to evolve antennas, but this, of course, will lead to unpredictable behavior. The restoration of the population will only take effect before a new evolution run or after (a potential) current evolution run has terminated, but not in between an evolution run.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the file to restore the population from
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        See Also:
        Individual.Individual(java.lang.String)

      • getFreezer

        public boolean getFreezer()
        Gets the freezing state of the population.
        Returns:
        true, if population is frozen

      • setFreezer

        public void setFreezer(boolean freeze)
        Freezes the population starting with the next generation. The current generation is simply copied to the next generation, and nothing is altered (no mutation, no crossover). This method may be called during a running JEvolution. It is not yet synchronized, as it seems unlikely that multiple tasks control a JEvolution. This method is very likely only useful in co-evolutionary settings.
        Parameters:
        freeze - true, if population to be frozen

      • isMeteorite

        public boolean isMeteorite()
        Returns the meteorite status.
        Returns:
        true, if meteorites active

      • setMeteorite

        public void setMeteorite(boolean meteorite)
        Sets the meteorite status.
        Parameters:
        meteorite - true, if active

      • setMaximalGenerations

        public void setMaximalGenerations(int maximalGenerations)
                           throws JEvolutionException
        Changes maximal number of generations.
        Parameters:
        maximalGenerations - generations per run
        Throws:
        JEvolutionException - meaningless number

      • getMinimalGenerations

        public int getMinimalGenerations()
        Gives minimal number of generations. This number of generations is always executed regardless of any other termination criteria.
        Returns:
        minimalGenerations minimal generations per run (default 0)

      • setMinimalGenerations

        public void setMinimalGenerations(int minimalGenerations)
                           throws JEvolutionException
        Changes minimal number of generations. This number of generations is always executed regardless of any other termination criteria.
        Parameters:
        minimalGenerations - minimal generations per run (default 0)
        Throws:
        JEvolutionException - meaningless number

      • getFitnessThreshold

        public double getFitnessThreshold()
        Gives the fitness threshold of this evolutionary cycle. Above (below in case of minimization) (or equal to) this fitness evolution is halted. However, the minimal number of generations is always executed.
        Returns:
        the fitness value where evolution is terminated (default Double.MAX_VALUE or Double.MIN_VALUE)
        See Also:
        setMinimalGenerations(int)

      • setFitnessThreshold

        public void setFitnessThreshold(double fitnessThreshold)
        Changes the fitness threshold. Above (below in case of minimization) (or equal to) this fitness evolution is halted. However, the minimal number of generations is always executed.
        Parameters:
        fitnessThreshold - the fitness value to terminate evolution
        See Also:
        setMinimalGenerations(int)

      • getTimeLimit

        public double getTimeLimit()
        Returns the time limit.
        Returns:
        maximal time allowed for evolution

      • setTimeLimit

        public void setTimeLimit(double timeLimit)
                  throws JEvolutionException
        Sets the time limit for evolution. Note that the minimal number of generations is always executed. If the time limit is approached before the maximal number of generations is computed, the run is terminated.
        Parameters:
        timeLimit - maximal evolution time
        Throws:
        JEvolutionException - if time is negative or zero

      • getFitnessComparator

        public java.util.Comparator<Individual> getFitnessComparator()
        Returns the fitness comparator.
        Returns:
        the fitness comparator

      • getShuffleRate

        public double getShuffleRate()
        Returns the shuffle rate.
        Returns:
        the probability to shuffle homologous chromosomes

      • setShuffleRate

        public void setShuffleRate(double shuffleRate)
        Sets the shuffle rate. Shuffling is only meaningful, if you use more than one Chromosome for your genotype. If Chromosomes are shuffled, equivalent Chromosomes are exchanged randomly between the parents with the given probability (= shuffle rate).
        Parameters:
        shuffleRate - the probability to shuffle homologous chromosomes
        See Also:
        addChromosome(evSOLve.JEvolution.chromosomes.Chromosome)

      • doesMaximization

        public boolean doesMaximization()
        Returns status of optimization.
        Returns:
        true, if maximization, false minimization

      • setMaximization

        public void setMaximization(boolean maximization)
        Sets status of optimization. Also changes 'fitnessThreshold' to the respective default value (Double.MAX_VALUE for maximization, Double.MIN_VALUE for minimization).
        Parameters:
        maximization - true, if maximization

      • getGenerationCount

        public int getGenerationCount()
        Returns the current generation. It starts with generation 0 being the start generation. The number changes, when a new population is ready for fitness evaluation.
        Returns:
        the current generation

      • getEvolutionTime

        public double getEvolutionTime()
        Returns the time spent for evolution.
        Returns:
        the evolution time in seconds
